summary: Simon shares important statement regarding launch-day stress
mainText:
'IMPORTANT

We expect over 1 million players on the early access release day for Hytale (January 13). Please download the launcher today and log in now to help us significantly reduce launch-day stress. Let us know if you are having any issues.

Download now: https://hytale.com/download'

summary: Paris, re: Hytale approaching

summary: Paris, re: Hytale approaching
mainText:
'I got my dream job, got engaged to the most wonderful woman, lost my dream job, got re-hired for my dream job - except under far better circumstances.
And now my first ever shipped game as a professional game developer will be... Hytale?üò≠'

summary: Paris, re: Hytale approaching
mainText:
'Doesn't quite feel real yet does it?
It never has to me, didn't 2 years ago, and still doesn't now.

If I could only show a glimpse of the present to my past self, I would have been so much more hopeful for the future, I would have been a happier person.'

summary: Slikey, re: Hatsuya appreciating how easy it seems to be to make mods/world gen alterations
mainText: 'I hope that - even if things are still too difficult in the beginning - people will pick it up again and try again in a year. There will be many improvements and documentation available to lower the barrier of entry.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking about roadmap
mainText:
'Once everything calms down a bit, we will talk about the many roadmaps very openly. There is a lot of work to do and we will make sure that we don't leave the community wondering if we are aware of a shortcoming and in which order we would address them. 
It will be quite difficult to keep an overview in the beginning and we need to find a good format on how to communicate the roadmaps without it becoming too bureaucratic.
We won't be able to tell you on what date a feature / improvement lands but I want the community to understand what our order of operation is to manage expectations.'

summary: Slikey, re: creator/modding vision being understood more now
mainText:
'Very happy to see how the creator / modding vision became more and more understood after everything we have shown. Saw this great video by @EmberwulfZ. 
Now that the vision is better understood, we can work together to fix the shortcomings and talk about roadmaps. 
Obviously what we said before is still true: Our priority remains our adventure mode but given what you have seen, you can also see how that doesn't mean that progress is mutually exclusive.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fR-hdc-Hjcw'

summary: Simon, re: Hugo saying NPCs are still a bit goofy, looking forward to improvements
mainText: 'NPC will get so much better over time, some are properly configured and quite smart already, we have blogpost coming up'

btw there are other crafting bench types in-game, you‚Äôll see

We are having fun with Hytale, not going to try to please everyone!'

summary: Thomas, re: AI art being made with model trained on legally licensed content
mainText: 'I think if gen AI was made to help artists, it would be a different story. If artists had given their consent and would gain something in return, then it would be more ethical. Then remains the question of the disastrous impact data centers have on our planet...'

summary: Thomas, re: AI Slop
mainText: '"Gen AI is just a tool, you need to embrace it". No - A paintbrush, a Computer, Procreate, Zbrush, Blender are tools. Gen AI is like someone entering your home, stealing your drawings, cuting them with cissors, mashing it up together, and selling it as if it was theirs'

summary: Thomas, re: AI Slop
mainText: 'And without all those human talents who built the databases that were robbed - there wouldn't be any of your favorite movies, games, songs or books. There wouldn't be anything to steal from, and AI bros would be playing with their poop, figuring out how to make money elsewhereüòò'

summary: Thomas, re: AI Slop
mainText: 'Gentle reminder that what "AI slop" people are creating actually comes from millions of stolen images, made by real people who worked their asses off to gain skill, talent and mastery in their respective fields - and, no, self proclaimed AI artists aren't Artists, just scammers'

summary: Paris, re: gathering foliage
mainText: 'It depends on the context of the item but for most decorative foliage you will optionally utilise a tool, to avoid accidentally cluttering the inventory with decorative blocks! :)'

summary: DSN, re: server binaries
mainText:
'We will release a downloader tool on launch day, it will be for downloading just the server binaries and assets. 

These will also come bundled in your installation of the game as they're required for single player.'

summary: Simon gives statement on the work the team has been putting in
mainText:
'As we get closer to the Hytale release, I think of all the sacrifices made to get here. From the team, the community and myself.

The past few months have been incredibly difficult for my family as I have been away, reviving the game and rebuilding the team. 7 days a week.

My kids have not seen much of me in the past few months, I have missed milestones, events, precious moments and most importantly, the time we could have been together can‚Äôt be brought back. Yet, they are still overjoyed to see me for the small moments we share, as I worry I could become a stranger to them.

My only hope is for my sons to be inspired the passion and wish for them to find the same joy in their lives. I will spend more time with them when the game is stabilized after launch, as I will feel relieved from the burden of this curse.

No sacrifices, no Hytale.'

summary: Slikey thinks about Bob Ross
mainText: 'I wonder if we will see a Bob Ross of Hytale builds.. The possibilities for creative builders are extensive and I am looking forward to watching relaxing building videos while we make the game good. ü§©'

summary: Slikey, re: server manual
mainText: 'Let me post the server manual on Sunday. I think I left everyone waiting enough now and it should answer your questions :)'

summary: Slikey, re: launcher issues
mainText: 'Please uninstall the launcher and reinstall it. Ensure that you are not getting a cached file from your browser. This issue was fixed but requires a manual reinstallation.'

summary: Slikey, re: launcher updates
mainText: 'We had to fix some issues and continue fixing issues in the future. Launcher patches may come at irregular intervals but will slow down over time. Just wait for how much we will have to patch the game in the first few weeks.. üò≠'

summary: Simon, re: Hytale's Early Access
mainText: 'We are almost home.'

summary: Thomas, re: user asking if they can use Hytale to create games and submit to gamejams
mainText: 'To clarify, Hytale is a moddable game more than a proper engine. Which means your players need to own Hytale to play your game.Yes it is a barrier to entry which unity/unreal don't have. But you can totally come to a game jam, make a Hytale game mod, and submit it/present it.  üôÇ'

summary: Simon, re: possibility of skipping nights
mainText: 'yes'

summary: Paris, re: user fearing Hytale might consume their life
mainText: 'same'

summary: Simon, re: Myne saying the lantern pet mod video might be the best gameplay video of Hytale
mainText: 'this is where the creatives will shine'

summary: Simon, re: fast travel
mainText:
'Im not a ¬´ big ¬ª fan of fast travel, but it was a necessity given the state of the game until we have proper features to compensate and push it a bit further in the gameloop.

I think its also important to create a sense of ¬´ village/home ¬ª so having ways to return home is critical to push players much further away from home'

summary: Paris, re: Acorn joking NoCube spoiled the essence of life
mainText: 'oops'

summary: Simon, re: Prowl making a statement on teleportation in Hytale
mainText:
'I would like for people to play the game before making up their minds about this decision and making suggestions! There is a reason it was added: we played the game many times and noticed major issues caused by the lack of transportation. 

It plays differently from other block games, and it's still in very early access, so it's missing many travel features.'

summary: Simon, re: Prowl and Chayzur writing document for traveling methods
mainText: 'Perfect, will be watching and listening to feedback!'

summary: Oscar, re: Myne's 'wake up babe, new Hytale tweet' meme
mainText: 'You gotta make one that says "wake up babe, Hytale release" for Tuesday'

summary: DSN, re: user saying the team should explain how to install on Linux

summary: Simon, re: hot air balloons at launch
mainText: 'nope'

summary: Simon, re: hooks not being at launch
mainText: 'Not enough time, it required proper implementation into main branch and was acting up, will add after launch'

summary: DSN, re: Hytale being unplayable
mainText: 'Still true'

summary: Simon, re: hookshot, glider being in the game at launch
mainText: 'Hook no. Glider is currently disabled in crafting because it's a super bad experience (available in creative, though). A patch coming after launch will enable it with "ok" configs. I tried to do a late-night fix on it, but I had too much going on and ended up just delaying it.'

summary: DSN, re: being logged out of the launcher before release
mainText: 'If you invalidate sessions on the account website it would, so long as you don‚Äôt do that you‚Äôre all set'

summary: Simon, re: grid crafting
mainText: 'We have no plans to ever include grid crafting, as it would go against the game's entire design!'

summary: DSN, re: stress testing today
mainText:
'Thank you to everyone who participated and helped stress our systems before launch with Hytales launcher release. 

We got a lot of great data and are busy making adjustments to make Tuesdays launch as smooth as possible. 

If you haven‚Äôt already check out http://accounts.hytale.com/download to get logged in and be ready for launch!'

summary: Simon, re: user being a fan of Waystone mod in MC
mainText: 'Yeah, we made simple teleporters (they need to be connected + are limited) for now. We wanted to do waypoints at some point too, but we ran out of time to do it properly.'
